definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4
